revision.text:
{{Infobox Single | Name = I Remember You | Cover = Skid Row - I Remember You.jpg | Artist = [[Skid Row (American band)|Skid Row]] | from Album = [[Skid Row (album)|Skid Row]] | Released = November 18, 1989 | Format = | Recorded = 1988 | Genre = [[Glam metal]] | Length = 5:14 | Label = [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]] | Writer = [[Rachel Bolan]]
[[Dave Sabo]] | Producer = [[Michael Wagener]] | Last single = "[[18 and Life]]"
(1989) | This single = "'''I Remember You'''"
(1989) | Next single = "[[Monkey Business (Skid Row song)|Monkey Business]]"
(1991) }} "'''I Remember You'''" is the third and final [[single (music)|single]] from [[Skid Row (American band)|Skid Row]]'s 1989 [[Skid Row (album)|eponymous debut album]]. The [[power ballad]] was released in November 1989 and written by bandmates [[Rachel Bolan]] and [[Dave "the Snake" Sabo]]. It reached number six on the [[Billboard Hot 100]] and number twenty-three on the [[Mainstream Rock Tracks]] in early 1990.{{cite web|last=Weber |first=Barry |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p5444/charts-awards/billboard-singles|pure_url=yes}} |title=Skid Row |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2010-10-15}} The song also charted at #36 on the [[UK Singles chart]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chartstats.com/artistinfo.php?id=5641 |title=Skid Row |publisher=Chart Stats |date= |accessdate=2010-10-15}} In 2003, Skid Row, this time featuring new lead singer Johnny Solinger, recorded a second version of the song entitled "'''I Remember You Two'''." The song appears in the album ''[[Thickskin]]''. In a 2007 interview, vocalist [[Sebastian Bach]] commented, "'I Remember You' was the #1 prom song in the United States of America in the year 1990....You talk about making memories! Literally the whole country of America did their prom dance to 'I Remember You' one year, and that's a real heavy memory to beat." {{cite web|url=http://www.sleazeroxx.com/news07/1128bac.shtml |title=Sebastian Bach Is Charged Up |publisher=Sleaze Roxx |date=2007-11-28 |accessdate=2010-10-15}} ==In popular culture== "I Remember You" appeared on the ABC series ''[[October Road (TV series)|October Road]]'', FOX's ''[[Reunion (TV series)|Reunion]]'', [[Comedy Central]]'s ''[[South Park]]'' and [[NBC|NBC's]] ''[[Friday Night Lights (TV series)|Friday Night Lights]]. In 2000, the punk rock band [[The Ataris]] covered the song for the compilation album [[Punk Goes Metal]]. The cover featured a few sampled bars of the original Skid Row version at the beginning and Sebastian Bach's high note at the climax of the song. The song was covered on ''[[Californication (tv series)|Californication]]'' at the end of the episode "The Recused" by fictional band Queens of Dogtown. This version also appears on the show's Season 4 soundtrack. On June 3, 2013, Amber Carrington sang a country version of "I Remember You" on The Voice. ==Track listing== # "I Remember You" # "Makin' a Mess" # "Big Guns" (Live) ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !align="left"|End of year chart (1990) ! style="text-align:center;"|Position |- |align="left"|U.S. ''Billboard'' Hot 100{{cite web|author=Billboard Top 100 - 1990 |url=http://longboredsurfer.com/charts.php?year=1990 |title=Billboard Top 100 - 1990 - Longbored Surfer - Charts |publisher=Longbored Surfer |date= |accessdate=2010-10-15}} | style="text-align:center;"|72 |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{MetroLyrics song|skid-row|i-remember-you}} {{Skid Row}} {{DEFAULTSORT:I Remember You (Skid Row Song)}} [[Category:Skid Row (American band) songs]] [[Category:1989 singles]] [[Category:1980s ballads]] [[Category:Glam metal songs]] [[Category:Rock ballads]] [[Category:Songs written by Dave Sabo]] [[Category:Songs written by Rachel Bolan]] [[Category:Atlantic Records singles]] {{metal-song-stub}} [[es:I Remember You (canci√≥n de Skid Row)]]
